byline.original: BY WILLIAM IRA BENNETT, M.D.; William Ira Bennett is the editor of The Harvard Medical School Health Letter

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: EVERY TIME SHE SEES ME SALTING THE spaghetti water, my daughter sucks in her breath with a slight, righteous whistle. She eats the spaghetti (and the lightly salted sauce), but with a shrug of self-sacrifice, contemplating what this dietary indiscretion will do, sooner or later, to her blood pressure.
